New Records: Ryan Helsley is one outing away from breaking the franchise record for most single-season saves since Trevor Rosenthal's 2015 performance
Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley logged his No. 48 save of the season against the Colorado Rockies in a 5-2 victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals' bullpen, led by Ryan Helsley, has been a reliable constant for the club this season
Post-Match Reflections: The Cardinals are looking forward to having Ryan Helsley back in the bullpen next season
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ryan Helsley has logged a 7-4 record with a 2.07 ERA, 77-to-23 strikeout-to-walk ratio,.209 batting average against and a 1.10 WHIP in 65 1/3 innings pitched for the Cardinals this season
